result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Eugene Damione Bady

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Eugene Damione Bady in court.  Attorney Sam Obscherning in court for Eugene Damione Bady.  Prosecuting attorney Josh Milder in court for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: SD. 
Final Pretrial held.  Parties remain in trial posture.  Any further motions will be heard on day of trial.  State revokes previous offer.  Case remains calendared for Jury Trial on 11/9/2022 at 9:00 am, Courthouse Room 501.
Received and Filed. State's Motion in Limine
Received and Filed. State's Witness List

Defendant Eugene Damione Bady in court.  Attorney Sam Obscherning in court for Eugene Damione Bady.  Prosecuting attorney Josh Milder in court for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: SD. 
Status Conference held.  Defense counsel requests final pretrial and jury trial dates.  State advised Court that DPA was offered in this case and will be revoked at final pretrial date.  Case adjourned, Br. 41.
Final pre-trial scheduled for October 24, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Jury trial scheduled for November 9, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Eugene Damione Bady in court with attorney Sam Obscherning.  Josh Milder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: SD.
Pretrial Conference held.  Defense counsel requests additional time to review offer and discovery.  Case adjourned, Br. 41.  Status conference scheduled for September 16, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered the cash bail be returned to the  remitter.
Court ordered no possession or use of any dangerous weapons or firearms.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with  T.S. (dob 1/28/1987).
No Weapons Order, signed and filed.
Court advised Defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Eugene Damione Bady in court.  Jack T Eichorst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Parties are advised that effective July 30, 2022 this case will be assigned to Judge Audrey Skwierawski, Branch 41 in Room 501 of the Courthouse.
Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Rosa, Branch 35.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Defendant IS Public Defender eligible. Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  
The case is adjourned to Br. 35 for a Pretrial Conference.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 18, 2022 at 08:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Eugene Damione Bady
Current: 4687 N 56th Street, Milwaukee, WI 53218   (Effective: 07-29-2022)
Prior: 1643 North 17th Street, Milwaukee, WI 53205
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 7/29/22 @ 1p
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 07/29/2022@1pm
